article.title: Galaxy @ BioHackathon-Europe 2021
article.tease: Advance the development of an open-source infrastructure for data integration
article.content:
Galaxy is a popular topic at BioHackathon-Europe 2021 and is a prominent part of many of this year's selected projects:

  • Support for the Common Workflow Language version 1.2 in Galaxy

    • Organizers: Nicola Soranzo

  • Galaxy training resources for CNVs detection software

    • Organizers: Krzysztof Poterlowicz

  • Implementation, testing and training on reference genome assembly pipelines for the eukaryotic tree of life

    • Organizers: Camila Mazzoni

  • Development of training modules for Gallantries

    • Organizers: Bérénice Batut

  • Improve FAIR sharing for workflow systems using WorkflowHub and RO-Crate

    • Organizers: Ignacio Eguinoa

  • Adapting and integrating RO-Crate for packaging research outputs and their metadata

    • Organizers: Stian Soiland-Reyes, Carole Goble

  • Making training materials FAIR: developing a lesson and a tool to assess FAIRness of training materials

    • Organizers: Patricia Palagi

Join us to learn from and work with experts of the Open Source Life Science community, and discuss plans for the ELIXIR Galaxy community and enjoy the great food and venue.

Interested? Registration is available on a first come, first serve basis. Registration is free, but space is limited. Register now.
